@cherrylzhao 
I looked at the source code of saga-4.0.0RC1 and reasonably configured saga. persistence. ds. The data source was instantiated directly in the process of instantiating the SagaSharingTransaction Manager object, but I don't know why it affected. Sharing failed in the project of creating a dataSource into a container，（org.apache.shardingsphere.shardingjdbc.spring.boot.SpringBootConfiguration.dataSource()）. It shouldn't have anything to do with it
ok, I have got the same error in my environment, I think you should just paste the full exception stack log next time.

@cherrylzhao  Sorry, I found the problem. I configure the SQL according to the official document. When I first create the object of SagaSharing Transaction Manager, I automatically create sql. It fails in the process of executing sql, which leads to subsequent failure.
you have resolved the problem?
@cherrylzhao yes
@cherrylzhao  I went to modify the sharding-transaction-base-saga source code to print the log, and dug into each execution method to find the execution SQL error.
@cherrylzhao I followed the official SQL and created the file schema-init.sql, but there was a problem when the SQL was executed in the framework.
how did you resolve the error, create table SQL is wrong from official site?

@cherrylzhao Create SQL and files to https://shardingsphere.apache.org/document/current/cn/manual/sharding-jdbc/usage/transaction/

Where will the source code go to the schema-init.sql file under the resources of the project? If it is not found, the logic of creating SQL will not be executed. I deleted the schema-init.sql from my project and the project started successfully.
execute schema-init.sql behavior is right, we should find the root cause why execute SQL throw exception.
@cherrylzhao  Official SQL is no problem. When I dug, I saw that the execution of SQL seemed to be no problem. But execution is, fail

@cherrylzhao  I duplicated the SQL executed in the framework and found that when two SQL statements were created in the file and read out, the first statement seemed to be all right, but when it was copied out to the SQL tool to execute, it made a mistake, a little similar. The key word "use" appeared in the field of table building.

## Bug Report

**For English only**, other languages will not accept.

Before report a bug, make sure you have:

- Searched open and closed [GitHub issues](https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere-example/issues).
- Read documentation: [ShardingSphere Doc](https://shardingsphere.apache.org/document/current/en/overview).

Please pay attention on issues you submitted, because we maybe need more details. 
If no response **more than 7 days** and we cannot reproduce it on current information, we will **close it**.

Please answer these questions before submitting your issue. Thanks!

### Which version of ShardingSphere did you use?

### Which project did you use? Sharding-JDBC or Sharding-Proxy?

### Expected behavior

### Actual behavior

### Reason analyze (If you can)

### Steps to reproduce the behavior, such as: SQL to execute, sharding rule configuration, when exception occur etc.

### Example codes for reproduce this issue (such as a github link).
the version I used is 4.0.0-RC1 and the project is Sharding-JDBC . I think the reason is that no short judgment in the isBroadcastTable method in the ShardingRule class.
what's mean for `short judgment`?
Please transfer this issue to HikariPool

@terrymanu 
I have found a discussion about the hikari pool(https://github.com/brettwooldridge/HikariCP/issues/1116). 
Based on the results of the discussion, I think I should explicitly specify isReadOnly. If not specified, the jdbc driver will throw an exception unpredictably, resulting in a connection not being established properly.

I think the YamlDataSourceParameter should add the isReadOnly parameter and set a default value, then
config.setReadOnly(dataSourceParameter.isReadOnly());

for example, spring use the "spring.datasource.read-only" to specify isReadOnly

Please let me know if there are other objections.
thanks very much, i will try to 4.0.0RC2 version.
`4.0.0RC2` version is not release yet. so I think this issue need stay open.
